info:
Nouns have three genders: masculine, feminine, and neuter.

Each noun has a fixed gender that must be memorized.

Nouns are capitalized regardless of position in a sentence.

Declension changes noun forms slightly based on case (nominative, accusative, dative, genitive).

Articles and adjective endings change according to gender, number, and case.
